experience: You and Angela N. both know Eric Keosky-Smith, Curtis Gunn, and 135 others
Angela N. can introduce you to 17 people at HMSA

•Systems Redesign Coordinator (SRC) provides oversight of Continuous Process Improvement, Lean Six Sigma, Systems Redesign and other activities related to the management of complex health care delivery. •Employs the use of Lean Six Sigma methodologies to drive process improvement. Assembles interdisciplinary/cross-departmental teams which include clinicians, administrators, subject matter experts (SMEs), community partners, VISN (regional) and/or VACO (national) representatives when appropriate, industry experts for best practices, and customers (Veterans & their families).•Promotes A3 Thinking. Uses A3 template to drive improvements from inception to completion. Ensures that project teams are 1) outlining the scope of the problem, 2) mapping the current state of process, 3) identifying barriers, 4) determining appropriate metrics to measure success, 5) defining the baseline, 6) developing SMART goals and deliverables, 7) considering cost and resource availability of proposed solutions, 8) restructuring practices so as to meet/exceed desired outcomes, 9) piloting possible solutions using Plan Do Study Act (PDSA) model, and 10) designing improvement to ensure sustainability. •Recommends changes in existing policies and guides policy-making decisions based on findings of process improvements. •Spearheads facility-wide cultural change through employee training, specifically Lean Six Sigma White Belt and Yellow Belt courses. Teaching Lean Six Sigma principles empowers staff to implement process improvements as soon as issues are identified. Through continuous learning, employees are better suited to overcome barriers resulting in motivated staff, enhanced communication and improved morale. •Teaches Yellow Belt courses 2 times per quarter for 12 – 30 employees. Collaborates with Veterans Engineering Resource Center (VERC) in delivery of quality employee education.•Use of electronic health records databases CPRS, VISTA, VSSC, OPES, SAIL, EQM, FILEMAN, CDW & Pyramid.

Provides program support essential to the direction and operation of the Consolidated Patient Account Center (CPAC), national Program Management Office (PMO), Quality & Performance (Q&P), Continuous Process Improvement (CPI) department responsible for business process standardization.  Duties include:•	Develops standard operating procedures, program policies and program documentation.•	Prepares and delivers presentations and reports on completed projects.•	Executes analytical reporting tools (cause/effect, trend, comparative and regression analysis).•	Provides support to management studies of quality, safety, effectiveness and efficiency.•	Applies analytical techniques, statistical methods and quality engineering tools to collect baseline information, to identify limitations in current systems and to discover potential improvements.
Program Specialist (Program Manager - SCAN-ECHO / Coordinator - National VA Epilepsy Consortium)

Program manager for the SCAN-ECHO program, a national VA initiative that provides provider-to-provider consultation services through video-teleconferencing.  Worked collaboratively with medical center physicians, nurse practitioners, directors, managers, as well as specific administrative and clinical areas (IT, Telehealth, CAC, Pain Management, Hepatitis C, Infectious Disease, Epilepsy, etc.) in the implementation of VA SCAN-ECHO and its related applications. Developed strategies for telehealth program expansion, development and implementation.Also acted as coordinator for the Program manager for the National VA Epilepsy Consortium, a nationwide network of VA physicians and other allied healthcare providers with interest and expertise in improving the health and well-being of Veteran patients with epilepsy through the integration of clinical care, education, and research across the VA healthcare system.
Fraud Waste and Abuse Program Manager

Expanded and enhanced the Fraud, Waste and Abuse Program at Community Health Plan of Washington which serves over 285,000 Medicare and Medicaid members.  Collaborated with Compliance Officer and Compliance Program Manager in the development of a strategic plan for Compliance department’s FWA Program. Performed Gap Analysis and Risk Analysis as a means of identifying vulnerabilities and developing deliverables needed to meet Medicare/Medicaid requirements.  Developed the methodology for proactively initiating fraud investigations using common health care fraud indicators (red flags), claims data, pre and post payment review and system edits.  During tenure as Fraud, Waste and Abuse Program Manager, authored the FWA portion of the RFP for with CHPW's FWA program received Best Practice acknowledgement for Fraud Referral from HCA during Consensus Scoring RFP 2012. Active member of CHPW’s Healthcare Economics Workgroup, Appeals Committee, Quality Council, and the Strategic Medicare Advantage Rescue Team (SMART). Revised policies and procedures relative to Qui Tam, False Claims Act, Identity Theft and general Fraud, Waste and Abuse. Prepared quarterly reports for Ethics and Compliance Committees.

Responsible for various disease management, utilization management & quality improvement initiatives at HMSA (Blue Cross Blue Shield of Hawaii), Hawaii’s largest health insurer, servicing 600,000+ members with a network of 5,600 physicians, dentists, hospitals, pharmacies & other health care providers.Acted as project Lead for the QUEST (Medicaid) Pay for Performance LDL Control greater than 100 mg/dL in Diabetes project. Met state standards for Medicaid LDL Cholesterol Control in Diabetes by educating members on the importance of diabetes-associated risk factors for cardiovascular disease (CVD), specifically the role of lipid levels via member mailings, telephonic outreach and Interactive Voice Response technology. Meeting threshold resulted in the receipt of a $30,000 withhold from Medicaid as well as approximately $80,000 in long-term cost savings due to a reduction in members with uncontrolled LDL cholesterol levels. Acted as project lead for HMSA's Spotlight on Health Project– a public-facing initiative that shares HEDIS specific information with HMSA members through use “up-selling at the register” technique (commonly employed in retail/banking industries to extend lines of credit) during incoming customer service calls / walk-in transactions; effected change in corporate culture; initiative taken from concept to normal operations in 2 months time. Ensured implementation by training Care Coordination project leads and Customer Relations staff. Designed toolkit with clinical guides and quick reference materials. Developed "Train The Trainer" curriculum for Customer Relations Department initiative leads. Provided classroom instruction to Customer Relations representatives monthly specific to the monthly health focus and a tutorial on how to deliver the standardized scripted clinical message. Evaluated and tracked this initiative. Collaborated with IT department in the creation of the website for this initiative.

summary: Angela N. Vargas, MBA has 15+ years experience in military, government and civilian non-profit and for-profit healthcare to include medical facilities, specialty clinics, clinical laboratories, health insurance companies, and patient account centers.Skills: Program Management, Project Management, Program Evaluation, Quality Improvement, Process Improvement, Strategic Planning, Lean Six Sigma, Disease Management, Disease Prevention, Health Care Reform (ACA), Fraud Waste and Abuse Identification, Fraud Investigation, Health Care Compliance, State and Federal Regulatory Oversight, Teaching/Training, Mentorship, Customer ServiceThe biggest single problem in communication is the illusion that it has occurred. ― George Bernard Shaw
name: Angela N. Vargas, MBA
title: Systems Redesign Coordinator at U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs
